alert.note: Alert for Fauquier; Frederick; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 22 at 8:56PM EDT until June 23 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northern Virginia and northwest Virginia, including the following counties: in northern Virginia, Fauquier. In northwest Virginia, Frederick, Madison, Page, Rappahannock, Shenandoah and Warren. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 856 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Front Royal... Strasburg... Woodstock... Luray... Stanley... Sperryville... Star Tannery... Big Meadows... Middletown... Edinburg... Chester Gap... Maurertown... Toms Brook... Washington... Compton... Rileyville... Bentonville... Seven Fountains... Saint Davids Church... Dilbeck... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
